intro: Botrychium obliquum f. occidentale, commonly known as the western moonworts, is a fern-like plant belonging to the family Osmundaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, fiddlehead-like fronds that unfurl into a complex, branched structure. The plant has a unique morphology with a central stalk and two opposite, spirally arranged leaf-like structures. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically in forests or along streams. Botrychium obliquum f. occidentale is a rare and ancient species, often found in the western United States.
